snippet: The Qaeda leadership said it was no longer connected to the Islamic State of Iraq and Syria, which has asserted an increasingly important role in the Syrian conflict.
abstract: Al Qaeda's central leadership has officially cut ties with the Islamic State of Iraq and Syria, powerful jihadist group that has flourished in the chaos of the civil war in Syria.

byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: The Qaeda leadership said it was no longer connected to the Islamic State of Iraq and Syria, which has asserted an increasingly important role in the Syrian conflict.

headline.main: Al Qaeda Breaks With Jihadist Group in Syria Involved in Rebel Infighting
headline.print_headline: Al Qaeda Breaks With Jihadist Group in Syria Involved in Rebel Infighting

keywords.value: Islamic State of Iraq and Syria

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
